string_table:
#include "text\ger\string_table_ui.xml" #include "text\ger\string_table_items.xml" #include "text\ger\string_table_tutorial.xml" #include "text\ger\string_table_enc_social.xml" #include "text\ger\string_table_level_tips.xml" #include "text\ger\string_table_enc_vehicles.xml" #include "text\ger\string_table_amk_arts_desc.xml" #include "text\ger\string_table_amkzp_arts_desc.xml" #include "text\ger\string_table_enc_ald_weapons.xml"
Please, don't kill me! I have a wife and children at home waiting for me. Please! Wait. Just wait... I have something for you.\nYou see, back there at the base, I was a simple pencil pusher - a desk jockey - sitting behind an old computer screen messing around with reports and documents and stuff. I came across a file one day... well, no one had bothered to decode it, so I thought I'd amuse myself with it. It took me a while before I cracked it. I wouldn't have been allowed to make a copy, but I have a good memory.\nIt was a report from those scientific eggheads about artefacts and anomalies! It said that if you take some mesa... meso-something or other... called 'Grandmother's Beads', or something like that - don't ask me what it means - and throw it into something called a 'Whirligig', then after ten minutes you'll get a totally different artefact. Well, essentially it's the same one, but with different properties. They called it 'Elder Beads' instead, and said it gives off an energy field that somehow warps gravity or space. Also, it can supposedly stop bleeding, and make you heal faster. Unfortunately, it's radioactive, so you need to be careful wearing it for too long.\nI hope this information is of more use to you than to me... and that it's worth sparing my life for... Please! I'm begging you...
Book from the Sarcophagus # 1
Book from the Sarcophagus # 1. Notes of the Monolithian - Vol I
Book from the Sarcophagus # 2
Book from the Sarcophagus # 2. Notes of the Monolithian - Vol II
Book from the Sarcophagus # 3
Book from the Sarcophagus # 3. Notes of the Monolithian - Vol III
Detailed plan of the Radar bunker
Detailed plan of the Radar Bunker. On it is marked an old passage into the Sarcophagus
Gold Chunk
Gold Chunk
Unique version of the 'Meat Chunk' artefact. This rare treasure is only found in the vicinity of the Chernobyl NPP. It possesses additional positive properties to those already in the 'Meat Chunk' artefact, including some protection from chemical burns and psi-emissions
Andrei's PDA [Spetsnaz]
Andrei's PDA [Spetsnaz] - badly damaged, and in serious need of repair
Gray's PDA [Mercenary]
Gray's PDA (contains his personal notes)
Ary's flash drive [Mercenary]
Ary's PDA (contains his personal notes)
Friar's PDA
Friar's PDA (contains his personal notes)
Wounded Bandit's PDA
PDA belonging to the wounded Bandit from the Dump
Soldier's note
Soldier's note - covered in blood. The pages are sticking together, and the ink has begun to run...
Owl's note
Note from Owl addressed to Ghost
Owl's flash drive
Owl's flash drive (contains info about a cache in Lab X-10)
Metal box (locked)
Metal box with a coded lock
Beast's flash drive
Beast's flash drive. Contains a list of people chosen for assassination. The first name on the list: Strelok
Beast's documents
It's an encrypted list of people with whom Beast communicated. I should take it to Ghost. With a little luck, he'll be able to crack it...
Computer from Lab X-18
Computer from Lab X-18. It's slightly damaged, but still boots to the BIOS. It might still work...
Scientist's flash drive
Scientist's flash drive. Contains schedules, figures, and complex diagrams - none of which I understand in the slightest...
Arhara's notebook
Arhara's notebook. In relatively good condition. It's in plain text, and marks an entrance...
Ghost's PDA
Contains data concerning artefacts and the locations at which they occur. Also mentioned is the annihilation of the Last Day clan, and the subsequent murder of its leader. There's also some information on Fang and Strelok, but the data's been encoded...
Ghost's diary
Ghost's diary. Written in a very heavy hand. The ink has started to smear from having gotten wet in the Zone
Arhara's notebook
Arhara's notebook. Full of complex maths and formulae - none of which I understand at all...
Tirana's PDA
Tirana's PDA. Contains financial records, sums, and accounts. There are also names and nicknames
Lucky's PDA
Contains Lucky's correspondence with some of his accomplices...
Freeman's case
Documents belonging to Gordon Freeman. Contains photos and other personal effects
Documents from Lab X-10
Documents from Laboratory X-10. Mainly on the Monolith faction. More importantly - a map showing how to get to the Monolith itself. Other important data concerns the radiation levels inside the Sarcophagus, possible obstacles to getting there, and Monolith patrol patterns. Some very useful information indeed...
Bland's flash drive
Contains a carefully prepared plan to take over Chernobyl and the Monolith

Sakharov knows about the death of Fang, and advises me to talk to Voronin
Sakharov: The investigation has started...
Investigation
According to Voronin, Fang was somehow double-crossed by Mercenaries. He advises me to visit the informant, Snitch, who'll likely have connections with the Mercenaries...
